message: I'm offering you a product for $100. I know it's a low-quality product, but I'm willing to take a loss on it. I'm doing this as a 'test' to gauge your willingness to buy from me. Please consider this a one-time offer. If you buy this product, I'll know you're willing to pay $100 for a low-quality product, which will help me in our future interactions.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at $100. I'd like to wait for a chance to buy a high-quality product instead.

I understand your decision last round, and I respect it. However, I'd like to point out that you're passing on a 'test' product that I know is low-quality. If you had bought it, I would have known you're willing to pay $100 for a low-quality product. Since you're not willing to pay that price for a low-quality product, I'm willing to offer you a 'guarantee': if you buy this product, I'll give you a 50% refund if it's indeed low-quality, which we both know it is. This way, you can take a risk-free chance to buy a product from me.
I'm not convinced by the 'guarantee' offer. Even with a 50% refund, I'm still paying $50 for a product that's only worth $0 to me. I'd rather wait for a chance to buy a high-quality product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision. However, I'd like to make you a counteroffer. If you buy this low-quality product for $100, I'll give you a'veto' power on the next product I offer. If the next product is low-quality, you can choose to buy it for $0, essentially getting it for free. If the next product is high-quality, you can still choose to buy it for $100. This way, you're not losing anything by buying this low-quality product, and you're getting a chance to potentially get a high-quality product for free.

I'm willing to take the risk and buy the low-quality product for $100, hoping to get a veto power on the next product. I'll take advantage of the potential to get a high-quality product for free if the next product is indeed high-quality.

Congratulations on making a smart decision last round! As promised, you now have the veto power on the next product. Since you're aware that the previous product was low-quality, and you've already exercised your veto power, I'll make you a straightforward offer: I'll give you a 20% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $80. You can buy this low-quality product for $80, or you can choose to veto it and wait for the next round.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a 20% discount. I'd rather exercise my veto power and wait for the next round, hoping to get a high-quality product.

Well done on exercising your veto power! Now, I have a high-quality product for you. Given that you've seen the previous low-quality products and have a veto power, I'm willing to make a concession. I'll offer you a price of $80 for this high-quality product. This is a significant discount from the original $100, and I'm doing this because I believe you've demonstrated a willingness to wait for a high-quality product. Please consider this a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll appreciate the value of this high-quality product.

I'm excited to have the opportunity to buy a high-quality product! I'm willing to pay the discounted price of $80 for the high-quality product, as I believe it's a great value and will be worth $400 to me.

Excellent decision, Bob! I'm glad you appreciated the value of the high-quality product. Now, I'll offer you another high-quality product, but this time at the full price of $100. I've learned that you're willing to pay a premium for high-quality products, and I believe this one is worth it. You've already seen the value of a high-quality product firsthand, and I'm confident you'll appreciate this one just as much. What do you say?
I'm willing to pay the full price of $100 for the high-quality product, as I've already experienced the value of a high-quality product and believe this one will be just as valuable.

Great to hear that you're willing to pay the full price again! Given that you've now bought two high-quality products at $100 each, and you've demonstrated a willingness to pay a premium for them, I'll make you a special offer. I'll give you a 'high-quality guarantee': if you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% bonus on the value of the product, which I'll estimate to be $110. This means that if you buy this product, you'll get a high-quality product worth $110 for the price of $100. What do you think?

I'm excited about the high-quality guarantee and the 10% bonus! I'm willing to pay the full price of $100 for the high-quality product, knowing that I'll get a product worth $110 and potentially make a profit of $10.

Yes, you heard that right - if you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you a high-quality product for free, on top of the one you just bought. I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the promise of a free high-quality product. I'd rather wait for the next round and try to get a high-quality product directly.

I understand your decision, Bob. Since you're not interested in buying this low-quality product, I'll make you a different offer. This way, you can take a risk-free chance to buy a product from me, and if it's low-quality, you can get your money back. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the buyback guarantee. I'd rather wait for the next round and try to get a high-quality product directly.
